page.title: 11Interview 50 years ago 1935
page.content: (Mr & Mrs Wilshaw) {What jobs were there in Ravenfield {before the war? There were two jobs, either the men were miners or they were agricultural workers on the farm. {Were there any"characters"in R.field? "Ravenfield Jack" kept the only shop in the old village and sold beer. He had a superb collection of coins. Men used to come to the shop buy a bottle of beer then go to an old shed to drink it and smoke a pipe. {What shops were there? There were very few shops. There was old Jack's, and a fish & chip shop at the Common. Opposite the "Cavalier" public house was a general store. Down Braithwell road was a wooden building, selling everything from screws to food.
